info.title: Chat App API
info.description: Chat applications support session persistence, allowing previous chat history to be used as context for responses. This can be applicable for chatbot, customer service AI, etc.

servers.description: The base URL for the Chat App API. Replace {api_base_url} with the actual API base URL provided for your application (e.g., from props.appDetail.api_base_url).

api_base_url.description: Actual base URL of the API

post.description: Send a request to the chat application.

requestBody.description: Request body to send a chat message.

value.query: What are the specs of the iPhone 13 Pro Max?

200.description:
Successful response. The content type and structure depend on the `response_mode` parameter in the request.
- If `response_mode` is `blocking`, returns `application/json` with a `ChatCompletionResponse` object.
- If `response_mode` is `streaming`, returns `text/event-stream` with a stream of `ChunkChatEvent` objects.

schema.description: A stream of Server-Sent Events. Each event is a JSON object prefixed with 'data: ' and suffixed with '\n\n'. See `ChunkChatEvent` for possible event structures.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error codes:
- `invalid_param`: Abnormal parameter input.
- `app_unavailable`: App configuration unavailable.
- `provider_not_initialize`: No available model credential configuration.
- `provider_quota_exceeded`: Model invocation quota insufficient.
- `model_currently_not_support`: Current model unavailable.
- `completion_request_error`: Text generation failed.

post.description: Upload a file (currently only images are supported) for use when sending messages, enabling multimodal understanding of images and text. Supports png, jpg, jpeg, webp, gif formats. Uploaded files are for use by the current end-user only.

file.description: The file to be uploaded. Supported image types: png, jpg, jpeg, webp, gif.

user.description: User identifier, defined by the developer's rules, must be unique within the application. **Note**: The Service API does not share conversations created by the WebApp. Conversations created through the API are isolated from those created in the WebApp interface.

get.description: Preview or download uploaded files. This endpoint allows you to access files that have been previously uploaded via the File Upload API. Files can only be accessed if they belong to messages within the requesting application.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the file to preview, obtained from the File Upload API response.

parameters.name: as_attachment
parameters.description: Whether to force download the file as an attachment. Default is `false` (preview in browser).

200.description: File content returned successfully. Headers set based on file type and request parameters.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error codes:
- `invalid_param`: Abnormal parameter input.

403.description:
Forbidden. Possible error codes:
- `file_access_denied`: File access denied or file does not belong to current application.

404.description:
Not Found. Possible error codes:
- `file_not_found`: File not found or has been deleted.

get.description: Returns historical chat records in a scrolling load format, with the first page returning the latest `{limit}` messages, i.e., in reverse order.

parameters.name: conversation_id
parameters.description: Conversation ID.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: User identifier. **Note**: The Service API does not share conversations created by the WebApp. Conversations created through the API are isolated from those created in the WebApp interface.

parameters.description: The ID of the first chat record on the current page, default is null (for fetching the latest). For subsequent pages, use the ID of the first message from the current list to get older messages.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: How many chat history messages to return in one request, default is 20.

ApiKeyAuth.description: API Key authentication. For all API requests, include your API Key in the `Authorization` HTTP Header, prefixed with 'Bearer '. Example: `Authorization: Bearer {API_KEY}`. **Strongly recommend storing your API Key on the server-side, not shared or stored on the client-side, to avoid possible API-Key leakage that can lead to serious consequences.**

BadRequestFile.description:
Bad Request for file operations. Possible error codes:
- `no_file_uploaded`: A file must be provided.
- `too_many_files`: Currently only one file is accepted.
- `unsupported_preview`: The file does not support preview.
- `unsupported_estimate`: The file does not support estimation.

UnsupportedFileTypeFile.description: `unsupported_file_type`: Unsupported extension. (Note: The description for `/files/upload` lists image types, while this generic error mentions document files. This might indicate a context-specific message from the backend).

S3ErrorFile.description:
Service Unavailable for S3 operations. Possible error codes:
- `s3_connection_failed`: Unable to connect to S3 service.
- `s3_permission_denied`: No permission to upload files to S3.
- `s3_file_too_large`: File exceeds S3 size limit.

inputs.description: Allows the entry of various variable values defined by the App. Contains key/value pairs. Default {}.

response_mode.description: Mode of response return. `streaming` (recommended) uses SSE. `blocking` returns after completion (may be interrupted for long processes; not supported in Agent Assistant mode). Cloudflare timeout is 100s.

user.description: User identifier, unique within the application. **Note**: The Service API does not share conversations created by the WebApp. Conversations created through the API are isolated from those created in the WebApp interface.

conversation_id.description: Conversation ID to continue a conversation. Pass the previous message's conversation_id.

auto_generate_name.description: Auto-generate conversation title. Default `true`. If `false`, use conversation rename API with `auto_generate: true` for async title generation.

transfer_method.description: Transfer method, `remote_url` for image URL / `local_file` for file upload

url.description: Image URL (when the transfer method is `remote_url`)

upload_file_id.description: Uploaded file ID, which must be obtained by uploading through the File Upload API in advance (when the transfer method is `local_file`)

ChatCompletionResponse.description: Response object for blocking mode chat completion.

task_id.description: Task ID for request tracking and stop response API.

id.description: Unique ID of this response/message event.
